property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.address
property.description: The address the LlamaAM server listen at. If 0.0.0.0 is specified as IP, the server will listen in all available network addresses. If the port is not specified, the default port is 15000. If the specified port is 0, an ephemeral port will be used, the port in use will be printed in the logs at startup.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.server.min.threads
property.description: Minimum number of threads used by the LlamaAM server uses for serving client requests.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.server.max.threads
property.description: Maximum number of threads used by the LlamaAM server uses for serving client requests. This should be to to the size of the cluster plus a buffer (thrift synch IO requires one thread per connection, we need one connection per impalad node).

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.transport.timeout.ms
property.description: Socket time, in milliseconds, used LlamaAM server for all its server and client Thrift connections.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.client.notifier.queue.threshold
property.description: Threshold of the outstanding client notification queue size to start producing warnings. The queue will continue to queue notifications requests when above the threshold.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.client.notifier.threads
property.description: Number of threads used to do client notifications.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.client.notifier.max.retries
property.description: Maximum number of retries for a client notification. After the maximum number of client notification retries has been reached without success the client is considered lost and all its reservations are released. A successful client notification resets the retries count.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.client.notifier.retry.interval.ms
property.description: Client notification retry interval, in milliseconds.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.client.notifier.heartbeat.ms
property.description: Heartbeat interval (if no other notification happened), from LlamaAM server to clients.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.node.name.mapping.class
property.description: The NodeMapper implementation LlamaAM server uses to convert requested locations into Yarn Nodes. The default (and only implementation for production) drops the port number if present (Impala uses DataNode addresses to request a location, these addresses may contain the DataNode port number. The DataNode port number is meaningless and unknown to Yarn).

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.admin.address
property.description: The admin address the LlamaAM server listen at. If 0.0.0.0 is specified as IP, the server will listen in all available network addresses. If the port is not specified, the default port is 15002. If the specified port is 0, an ephemeral port will be used, the port in use will be printed in the logs at startup. IMPORTANT: It is strongly recommended to use 'localhost' as the bind address when security is not enabled.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.http.address
property.description: The address the LlamaAM server exposes its HTTP server for JMX and the Web UI. If 0.0.0.0 is specified as IP, the server will listen in all available network addresses. If the port is not specified, the default port is 15001. The HTTP JSON JMX servlet is exposed over HTTP at '/jmx', i.e.: http://localhost:15001/jmx If the specified port is 0, an ephemeral port will be used, the port in use will be printed in the logs at startup.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.loggers.servlet.read.only
property.description: If the /loggers servlet is read only. If not in read only mode, the servlet can be used to change logger levels.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.security
property.description: Indicates if security is enabled or not. If enabled, LlamaAM server uses Kerberos Thrift SASL for all server and client Thrift connections.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.security.QOP
property.description: Indicates the quality of protection if security is enabled. Valid values are: 'auth' : authentication 'auth-int' : authentication and integrity 'auth-conf' : authentication, integrity and confidentiality

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.kerberos.keytab.file
property.description: The location of the LlamaAM server keytab. If the path is relative, the keytab file is looked up in LlamaAM configuration directory.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.kerberos.server.principal.name
property.description: LlamaAM Kerberos principal name. 'localhost' must be replaced with the hostname specified in the service principal.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.kerberos.notification.principal.name
property.description: Principal short name, without the service hostname, used for client notifications. The hostname provided in the client address at registration by the client will be used as service hostname. IMPORTANT: they client hostname address provided at registration must match the service name in the client's Kerberos principal.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.client.acl
property.description: ACL for Llama AM clients. The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel". A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.

property.name: llama.am.server.thrift.admin.acl
property.description: ACL for Llama AM admins. The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel". A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.

property.name: llama.am.cluster.id
property.description: Identification of a Llama (or an Active/Standby pair). YARN resources are grouped by this ID. When multiple applications on a YARN cluster use their own Llamas, it is recommended that they use different values for this config. On Llama restart, all YARN applications corresponding to this cluster-id are killed.

property.name: llama.am.rm.connector.class
property.description: Backing LlamaAM implementation to use. Available for functional testing: MockRMLlamaAMConnector

property.name: llama.am.rm.connector.recycle.interval.mins
property.description: Yarn AM-RM protocol does not have a way of renewing long lasting tokens. So, Llama recycles the yarn connectors to avoid any failures due to invalid tokens. By default its set to 75% of the value yarn.resourcemanager.delegation.token.renew-interval in yarn-site.xml. It can be overridden here but it should always be less than the yarn configured value.

property.name: llama.am.core.queues
property.description: Queues LlamaAM should connect to at start up. Unlike queues that are created in response to a reservation, these queues will never expire. IMPORTANT: all queue names should be canonical queue names, this is prefixed with "root.". This is required because Yarn normalizes queue names to their canonical name.

property.name: llama.am.gang.anti.deadlock.enabled
property.description: Enables Llama AM gang scheduling anti deadlock detection.

property.name: llama.am.gang.anti.deadlock.no.allocation.limit.ms
property.description: Interval of time without any new allocation that will trigger the Llama AM anti-deadlock logic.

property.name: llama.am.gang.anti.deadlock.backoff.percent
property.description: Percentage of resources that will be backed off by the Llama AM anti-deadlock logic. Random reservations will be backed off until the percentage of backed off resources reaches this percentage.

property.name: llama.am.gang.anti.deadlock.backoff.min.delay.ms
property.description: Minimum amount of time the backed off reservations will be in 'backed off' state. The actual amount time is a random value between the minimum and the maximum.

property.name: llama.am.gang.anti.deadlock.backoff.max.delay.ms
property.description: Maximum amount of time the backed off reservations will be in 'backed off' state. The actual amount time is a random value between the minimum and the maximum.

property.name: llama.am.throttling.enabled
property.description: Global setting that indicates if Llama should throttle reservations.

property.name: llama.am.throttling.enabled.#QUEUE#
property.description: Per queue setting that indicates if Llama should throttle reservations for the #QUEUE# queue. If not set, the 'llama.am.throttling.enabled' is used.

property.name: llama.am.throttling.maximum.placed.reservations
property.description: Global maximum number of reservations per queue. Once this number of reservations is reached for a queue, reservations are queued up.

property.name: llama.am.throttling.maximum.queued.reservations
property.description: Global maximum number of queued reservations per queue. Once this number of reservations is reached for a queue, new reservations are rejected.

property.name: llama.am.throttling.maximum.placed.reservations.#QUEUE#
property.description: Maximum number of reservations for #QUEUE# queue. Once this number of reservations is reached for the #QUEUE# queue, reservations are queued up. If this property is not set for the #QUEUE#, the global configuration property is used 'llama.am.throttling.maximum.placed.reservations'.

property.name: llama.am.throttling.maximum.queued.reservations.#QUEUE#
property.description: Maximum number of queued reservations for #QUEUE# queue. Once this number of reservations is reached for the #QUEUE# queue, new reservations are rejected. If this property is not set for the #QUEUE#, the global configuration property is used 'llama.am.throttling.maximum.queued.reservations'.

property.name: llama.am.mock.nodes
property.description: List of nodes to offer.

property.name: llama.am.mock.queues
property.description: List of queues to offer.

property.name: llama.am.mock.events.min.wait.ms
property.description: Minimum wait time, in milliseconds, for events to be delivered after reservation. Actual wait time is a random value.

property.name: llama.am.mock.events.max.wait.ms
property.description: Maximum wait time, in milliseconds, for events to be delivered after reservation. Actual wait time is a random value.

property.name: llama.am.cache.enabled
property.description: Global setting that indicates if Llama should cache allocated resources on release.

property.name: llama.am.cache.enabled.#QUEUE#
property.description: Per queue setting that indicates if Llama should cache allocated resources on release for the #QUEUE# queue. If not set, the 'llama.am.caching.enabled' is used.

property.name: llama.am.cache.eviction.run.interval.timeout.ms
property.description: Interval of time between eviction policy runs.

property.name: llama.am.cache.eviction.policy.class
property.description: The eviction policy for cached resources. The TimeoutEvictionPolicy evicts resources that have been sitting in the cache for a period of time equal or greater than the timeout.

property.name: llama.am.cache.eviction.timeout.policy.idle.timeout.ms
property.description: TimeoutEvictionPolicy policy timeout for resources sitting in the cache.

configuration.property:
llama.am.queue.expire.ms 300000
Time in milliseconds after which Llama will discard its AM for a queue that has been empty of reservations. Does not apply to queues specified with the llama.am.core.queues property. d

property.name: llama.am.resource.normalizing.enabled
property.description: Whether to break resource requests into smaller requests of standard size before the cache.

property.name: llama.am.resource.normalizing.standard.mbs
property.description: The standard size in MB to break requests into when normalizing is turned on.

property.name: llama.am.resource.normalizing.standard.vcores
property.description: The standard size in vcores to break requests into when normalizing is turned on.

property.name: llama.am.hadoop.user.name
property.description: User name use by Llama when interacting with Yarn.

property.name: llama.am.yarn.priority
property.description: Application priority when creating application in Yarn Resource Manager. NOTE: currently YARN does not use the application priority for scheduling decisions.

property.name: llama.am.yarn.app.monitor.timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout, in milliseconds, for waiting the Application Master to start or to stop.

property.name: llama.am.yarn.app.monitor.polling.ms
property.description: Polling interval, in milliseconds, to determine if the Application Master has started or stopped.

property.name: llama.am.yarn.app.heartbeat.interval.ms
property.description: LlamaAM Application Master heartbeat interval, in milliseconds. On each heartbeat the Application Master submits new reservations to Yarn Resource Manager and gets updates from it.

property.name: llama.am.yarn.container.handler.queue.threshold
property.description: Threshold of the outstanding container requests queue size to Yarn Node Managers to start producing warnings. The queue will continue to queue container requests when above the threshold.

property.name: llama.am.yarn.container.handler.threads
property.description: Number of threads used to do container requests to Yarn Node Managers.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.address
property.description: The address the Llama NM Auxiliary Service listen at. If 0.0.0.0 is specified as IP, the server will listen in all available network addresses. IMPORTANT: if security is enabled do not use 0.0.0.0, instead, use the exact same hostname used in the kerberos service principal of the LlamaNM auxiliary service (i.e. llama/HOSTNAME). If the port is not specified, the default port is 15100. If the specified port is 0, an ephemeral port will be used, the port in use will be printed in the logs at startup.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.server.min.threads
property.description: Minimum number of threads used by the LlamaNM auxiliary service uses for serving client requests.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.server.max.threads
property.description: Maximum number of threads used by the LlamaNM auxiliary service uses for serving client requests.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.transport.timeout.ms
property.description: Socket time, in milliseconds, used LlamaNM auxiliary service for all its server and client Thrift connections.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.client.notifier.queue.threshold
property.description: Threshold of the outstanding client notification queue size to start producing warnings. The queue will continue to queue notifications requests when above the threshold.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.client.notifier.threads
property.description: Number of threads used to do client notifications.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.client.notifier.max.retries
property.description: Maximum number of retries for a client notification. After the maximum number of client notification retries has been reached without success the client is considered lost and all its reservations are released. A successful client notification resets the retries count.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.client.notifier.retry.interval.ms
property.description: Client notification retry interval, in milliseconds.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.client.notifier.heartbeat.ms
property.description: Heartbeat interval (if no other notification happened), from LlamaNM auxiliary service to clients.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.security
property.description: Indicates if security is enabled or not. If enabled, LlamaNM auxiliary service uses Kerberos Thrift SASL for all server and client Thrift connections.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.kerberos.keytab.file
property.description: The location of the Llama NM auxiliary service keytab. If the path is relative, the keytab file is looked up in the Node Manager configuration directory.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.kerberos.server.principal.name
property.description: Llama NM auxiliary service keytab Kerberos principal name. 'localhost' must be replaced with the hostname specified in the service principal.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.kerberos.notification.principal.name
property.description: Principal short name, without the service hostname, used for client notifications. The hostname provided in the client address at registration by the client will be used as service hostname. IMPORTANT: they client hostname address provided at registration must match the service name in the client's Kerberos principal.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.client.acl
property.description: ACL for Llama NM clients. The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel". A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.

property.name: llama.nm.server.thrift.admin.acl
property.description: ACL for Llama NM admins. The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel". A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping
property.description: Class for user to group mapping (get groups for a given user) for ACL. The default implementation, org.apache.hadoop.security.JniBasedUnixGroupsMappingWithFallback, will determine if the Java Native Interface (JNI) is available. If JNI is available the implementation will use the API within hadoop to resolve a list of groups for a user. If JNI is not available then the shell implementation, ShellBasedUnixGroupsMapping, is used. This implementation shells out to the Linux/Unix environment with the bash -c groups command to resolve a list of groups for a user.

property.name: hadoop.security.groups.cache.secs
property.description: This is the config controlling the validity of the entries in the cache containing the user->group mapping. When this duration has expired, then the implementation of the group mapping provider is invoked to get the groups of the user and then cached back.

property.name: llama.am.ha.enabled
property.description: Enable Llama HA. When enabled, Llama starts in Standby mode and participates in leader election. When elected leader, it transitions to Active. When HA is enabled, one is required to set llama.am.ha.zk-quorum.

property.name: llama.am.ha.zk-quorum
property.description: The Zookeeper quorum to use for leader election and fencing when HA is enabled.

property.name: llama.am.ha.zk-base
property.description: The base znode to be used to store all HA-related information. If using the same Zookeeper quorum for multiple Llama clusters, make sure each Llama cluster has a separate base znode. Also, make sure the path is absolute, i.e., starts with "/".

property.name: llama.am.ha.zk-timeout-ms
property.description: The session timeout to be used for connections to the Zookeeper quorum.

property.name: llama.am.ha.zk-acl
property.description: ACLs to control access to the Zookeeper quorum used for HA.

property.name: llama.am.ha.zk-auth
property.description: Auth information to go with llama.am.ha.zk-acl
